<<<<<<< HEAD
Evangelium armatum, A specimen, or short collection of several doctrines and positions destructive to our government, both civil and ecclesiastical preached and vented by the known leaders and abetters of the pretended reformation such as Mr. Calamy, Mr. Jenkins, Mr. Case, Mr. Baxter, Mr. Caryll, Mr. Marshall, and others, &c. Assheton, William, 1641-1711. Calamy, Edmund, 1600-1666. Baxter, Richard, 1615-1691.
[12], 59 p. : ports.
Printed for William Garret, London : 1663.
Written by W. Assheton. Cf. Halkett & Laing (2nd ed.). Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
=======

Assheton, William, 1641-1711. Calamy, Edmund, 1600-1666. Baxter, Richard, 1615-1691.
[12], 59 p. : ports.
